entry.def: If someone is offered an inducement to do something, they are given or promised gifts or benefits in order to persuade them to do it.

example.ex: They offer every inducement to foreign businesses to invest in their states...
example.tran: 他们为外国企业提供种种优厚条件，以吸引这些企业到他们所在的州投资。

example.ex: Various inducements are offered to encourage employees to wear safety clothing.
example.tran: 他们提供各种奖励以鼓励员工穿安全服。

means.word_mean: 2. act of bringing about a desired result;

auth_sentence.content: Surely no financial inducement can be worth such abject loss of dignity.
auth_sentence.res_content: Surely no financial inducement can be worth such abject loss of dignity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Surely no financial inducement can be worth such abject loss of dignity.

auth_sentence.content: Earlier this month he also announced a ban on inducement advertising for this industry.

auth_sentence.content: He had no personal inducement to linger in a country which had treated him so ill.
auth_sentence.res_content: He had no personal inducement to linger in a country which had treated him so ill.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He had no personal inducement to linger in a country which had treated him so ill.
